page.title: 01Monynut Valley/Lammermuir
page.content: Part of the gentle, southern facing slopes of the Lammermuir Hills, deeply dissected by the Monynut water flowing in a narrow flat bottomed valley, the side slopes of which are occupied by natural oakwoods of comparative rarity in Berwickshire. The area is relatively remote but substantial areas of moorland have been reclaimed for improved grazing or even the occasional barley field. Moorland (heather and bracken) persists on steeper uncultivatable slopes and on areas about 300m to the north west. Conifer shelter belts on the plateau add interest to the landscape and these are joined by the new shining tower of the 400 feet overhead power line from Torness. There is a small touring caravan site in the Monynut valley.
